lines.content: NeuroSync helps psychiatrists **manage patient records and session notes efficiently**. Choose a topic below to get step-by-step instructions, troubleshoot issues, and maximize your productivity!
- üìÅ **Manage Patient Records** - Add, edit, and delete patient details.
- üìù **Session Notes** - Keep track of discussions, diagnoses, and treatments.
- üîé **Powerful Search & Filters** - Quickly retrieve any patient or note.
- ‚ö° **Command-Based Interface** - Fast, efficient, and easy to use.
NeuroSync **keeps track of patient details and session notes effortlessly**. No more searching through paper files‚Äîfind what you need **instantly** using powerful search and filter commands.
‚úÖ **Fast & Simple** - No unnecessary clicks, just type commands.
‚úÖ **Powerful Search & Filters** - Retrieve patient data in seconds.
2. Move the downloaded jar file to your preferred folder where you'd like to store your NeuroSync app
- NeuroSync runs exclusively on Java version 17
- To check your Java version, you can follow this [tutorial](https://www.java.com/en/download/help/version_manual.html)
* Open the folder where NeuroSync is saved
* Hold shift, right-click in the folder, select "Open Command Window Here"
* Type the following command and press Enter.
* Press `Command (‚åò) + Space` to open spotlight search, search for Terminal and open it
* Type `cd` (followed by a space), then drag and drop the folder where NeuroSync is saved into the Terminal window

| [Add Patient](#adding-a-patient) | `add n/NAME p/PHONE_NUMBER a/ADDRESS [t/TAG]‚Ä¶‚Äã`
`add n/John Doe p/98005442 a/123 Clementi Street t/ADHD` |

| [View Notes](#viewing-notes) | `viewnotes INDEX or viewnotes all`
`viewnotes 1 or viewnotes all` |

| [Add Note](#adding-a-note) | `note INDEX nt/TITLE nc/CONTENT`
`note 1 nt/Mood Assessment nc/Discussed mood swings and coping strategies.` |

| [Edit Note](#editing-a-note) | `editnote INDEX nt/TITLE nc/CONTENT`
`editnote 1 nt/Mood Assessment nc/Updated content with more details.` |
* Words in `UPPER_CASE` are the parameters to be supplied by the user.
e.g. in `add n/NAME`, `NAME` is a parameter which can be used as `add n/John Doe`.
* Items in square brackets are optional.
e.g `n/NAME [t/TAG]` can be used as `n/John Doe t/ADHD` or as `n/John Doe`.
* Items with `‚Ä¶`‚Äã after them can be used multiple times including zero times.
e.g. `[t/TAG]‚Ä¶‚Äã` can be used as `¬†` (i.e. 0 times), `t/ADHD`, `t/ADHD t/Depression` etc.
* Parameters can be in any order.
e.g. if the command specifies `n/NAME p/PHONE_NUMBER`, `p/PHONE_NUMBER n/NAME` is also acceptable.
* Extraneous parameters for commands that do not take in parameters (such as `help`, `list`, `exit` and `clear`) will be ignored.
e.g. if the command specifies `help 123`, it will be interpreted as `help`.

* If you are using a PDF version of this document, be careful when copying and pasting commands that span multiple lines as space characters surrounding line-breaks may be omitted when copied over to the application.
Each command is designed to make patient and session management **fast and intuitive**.
You can view all patients using the `list` command!
‚ö†Ô∏è **Warning:** This will show all patients, so be mindful if you have a large list.
üí° **Tip:** Use the [Find](#finding-a-patient) command to quickly locate a patient.
You can find a specific patient by their name,
phone number or address, using the `find` command.
‚ö†Ô∏è **Warning:** Multiple matches may be returned if you use a common name.
üí° **Tip:** Use specific names or words to narrow your search.
You can add new patients using their name, phone number, and address.
add n/John Doe p/98005442 a/123 Clementi Street t/ADHD
‚ö†Ô∏è **Warning:** Duplicate patient names are not allowed, for clarity.
> Names should only contain alphabets, numbers, spaces, and certain special characters `,.'-`
> Additionally, `s/o` and `d/o` are allowed between names (e.g, `Ridwan s/o Mista`)
You can change a patient's information using the `edit` command!
‚ö†Ô∏è **Warning:** Only update fields that need changing to avoid accidental edits.
üí° **Tip:** You can edit just one piece of data, e.g, only the phone number.
üí° You may also use **tags** (`t/`) to categorize patients (e.g., `t/Anxiety`).
After a patient recovers, you can delete them from NeuroSync using the index number listed next to their name.
üìù **Note**: Deleting a patient also deletes all of their notes.
üí° **Tip:** You can undo a delete using the [undo](#undo) command!
To see all notes at a glance!
viewnotes all    # View notes for all patients
‚ö†Ô∏è **Warning:** If a patient has many notes, it may take a moment to load.
üí° **Tip:** Use [Filter Notes](#filtering-notes) to narrow down results if you have many notes.
To see specific notes for one patient!
‚ö†Ô∏è **Warning:** Be specific with keywords to avoid too many results.
üí° **Tip:** Keywords should be part of the note's title for better results.
You can add notes to a patient to keep track of discussions, diagnoses, etc.
note 2 nt/Mood Assessment nc/Discussed mood swings and coping strategies.
üí° **Tip:** Keep notes short and concise, highlighting the most important aspects.
You can always make changes to your **note content** after creating it, using the `editnote` command!
editnote 2 nt/Mood Assessment nc/Patient showed signs of suicide. Discussed mood swings and coping strategies.
üí° **Tip:** You can edit only the necessary fields without altering other details.
If you no longer need a note, you can delete it using the `deletenote` command.
If you made a mistake, don't stress! You can **undo your previous change** using this command.
If you need to get back a change you undid, don't stress! You can **redo your previous change** using this command.
‚ö†Ô∏è **Warning:** Use with caution! This will instantly remove all data.
üí° **Tip:** You can recover your lost data using the **undo** command.
Opens a pop-up to give you the link to this User Guide
üí° **Tip:** Use **help** if you forget a command.
**A:** Your data is saved in `addressbook.json` inside the `/data` folder.
‚ö†Ô∏è **Warning:** Please do not modify `addressbook.json` as there could be unpredictable effects.
**A:** Yes! There is an [undo](#undo) feature, to recover data or undo edits.
**Q: How do I transfer data to another device?**
**A:** Copy the `addressbook.json` file from `/data` and paste it into the same directory on the new device.
This project is based on the AddressBook-Level3 project by the SE-EDU initiative.
Visit [se-education.org](https://se-education.org) for more open-source CS education projects.
For issues and contributions, please raise an issue or pull request in the [GitHub repository](https://github.com/AY2425S2-CS2103T-F13-1/tp).
